conclusion: Analyze forces acting on the charged ball to find electric field strength.
The image shows a ball suspended by a string at an angle θ with mass m and charge q.
Identify forces: gravitational force (mg), tension (T), and electric force (qE).
Resolve tension into vertical (T cos θ) and horizontal (T sin θ) components.
Set up equilibrium conditions: vertical (T cos θ = mg) and horizontal (T sin θ = qE).
Solve for tension T from vertical direction: T = mg/cos θ.
Substitute T into horizontal equation: (mg/cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify to mg tan θ = qE.
Solve for electric field strength E: E = mg tan θ / q.
